pr_title: ISPN-11266 Split CacheTopologyControlCommand into individual commands

timeline.message: ISPN-11266 Split CacheTopologyControlCommand into individual commands
ISPN-11266 Split CacheTopologyControlCommand into individual commands

timeline.bodyText: You don't need to create the Response. GlobalInboundInvocationHandler wraps the return value for you,
timeline.author: pruivo

timeline.bodyText: we can avoid sending the sender. You have ReplicableCommand.setOrigin(Address) that is invoked on the receiver side with the sender address.
timeline.author: pruivo

timeline.bodyText: CacheTopology has an externalizer. You can extract the code to static methods and invoke them. No need to declare all these fields neither copy-paste the write/read code.
timeline.author: pruivo

replies.bodyText: The CacheTopology externalizer will be removed, as well this writeTo implementation once the GlobalMarshaller is converted to protostream. I just lifted this code from the old command.
replies.author: ryanemerson

replies.bodyText:
I noticed the "copy-paste" style :)
How long until it is converted to protostream? Is it worth to make the change/refactorization?
replies.author: pruivo

replies.bodyText: I'm refactoring the commands to make the protostream conversion easier, so it's actually already started 🙂
replies.author: ryanemerson

timeline.bodyText: not sure what is the state about custom commands (or modules command).
timeline.author: pruivo

replies.bodyText: I think we can move it so that it's in the else block of the command instanceof GlobalRpcCommand, because if it's a GlobalRpcCommand (new interface as of 11) it should be utilising the component registry passed with invokeAsync. @danberindei Any thoughts?
replies.author: ryanemerson

timeline.bodyText: AFAIK, yes. I think can change the methods to receive AbstractTopologyCommand instead of ReplicableCommand.
timeline.author: pruivo

timeline.bodyText: this constructor isn't required. origin will be set on the receiver node.
timeline.author: pruivo

replies.bodyText: It is set on the receiver side, however the address is also used for local invocations so we need this in place. I tried removing the origin, however it results in the testsuite hanging.
replies.author: ryanemerson

replies.bodyText: ah! I see... the TopologyManagementHelper invokes the command directly. 👍
replies.author: pruivo

replies.bodyText: Ugh, maybe TopologyManagementHelper should be changed instead -- I'll have a look at it later :)
replies.author: danberindei

timeline.bodyText:
@link uses #
I also suggest adding new lines after . and/or before {@link to avoid splitting links.

timeline.bodyText:
This command probably shouldn't exist, and the rebalancing status/policy should be part of the join response.
It also looks a lot like RebalanceStatusCommand.
timeline.author: danberindei

timeline.bodyText:
You could have a single ShutdownCacheCommand and call either handleShutdownRequest or handleCacheShutdown based on whether the local node was the coordinator.
I'm not 100% sure it's a a good idea, but I thought I'd mention it :)
timeline.author: danberindei

replies.bodyText: IMO having the two distinct commands is much more explicit and will make reading trace logs easier.
replies.author: ryanemerson

replies.bodyText: Maybe... But I already forgot which command goes to the coordinator and which goes from the coordinator since reading the code yesterday :)
replies.author: danberindei

timeline.bodyText:
"should" is not strong enough IMO, I would say
{@code @Inject} annotations on implementations will be ignored, components must be accessed via the
{@link GlobalComponentRegistry} parameter of {@link #invokeAsync(GlobalComponentRegistry)}.

Also please start on a new line ;)
